Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Java class for writing WAV audio files with support for file rollover when reaching maximum size limits, using Java NIO's FileChannel for efficient file operations.

Class Description: WaveWriter is a class that handles the creation and writing of WAV audio files. It manages file channels, buffers, and WAV file formatting while supporting automatic file rollover when files reach a specified maximum size. The class implements AutoCloseable for proper resource management.

Attributes:
- mAudioFormat: [AudioFormat] - The audio format specification for the WAV file
- mFileRolloverCounter: [int] - Counter for tracking rolled-over file versions
- mMaxSize: [long] - Maximum allowed file size before rollover (0 means no limit)
- mFile: [Path] - Current file path being written to
- mFileChannel: [FileChannel] - NIO file channel for file operations
- mDataChunkOpen: [boolean] - Flag indicating if a data chunk is currently open
- mDataChunkSizeOffset: [long] - File position of the data chunk size field
- mDataChunkSize: [int] - Current size of the data chunk in bytes

Methods:
- WaveWriter: [constructor](AudioFormat format, Path file, long maxSize) -> [void] - Initializes a new WaveWriter with specified format, output file, and maximum size
- WaveWriter: [constructor](AudioFormat format, Path file) -> [void] - Initializes a new WaveWriter with no maximum size limit
- open: [private]() -> [void] - Opens a new file channel and writes initial WAV header
- close: [public]() -> [void] - Closes the file channel and performs cleanup
- close: [public](Path path) -> [void] - Closes the file channel and renames the file to the specified path
- writeData: [public](ByteBuffer buffer) -> [void] - Writes audio data to the file, handling rollover if needed
- closeDataChunk: [private]() -> [void] - Marks the current data chunk as closed
- openDataChunk: [private]() -> [void] - Opens a new data chunk in the WAV file
- rollover: [private]() -> [void] - Performs file rollover operation when reaching size limit
- updateTotalSize: [private]() -> [void] - Updates the total file size in the WAV header
- updateDataChunkSize: [private]() -> [void] - Updates the data chunk size in the WAV file
- getUnsignedIntegerBuffer: [protected static](long size) -> [ByteBuffer] - Creates a buffer with unsigned integer representation
- updateFileName: [private]() -> [void] - Updates the filename for rollover operations
- getDataHeader: [public static]() -> [ByteBuffer] - Creates a data chunk header buffer
- getWaveHeader: [public static](AudioFormat format) -> [ByteBuffer] - Creates a WAV file header buffer
- getFormatChunk: [public static](AudioFormat format) -> [ByteBuffer] - Creates a format chunk buffer for WAV file
